name: Shariah Supervisory Board (SSB) Approval
policySource: AAOIFI GS-1, QCB Shariah Governance Guidelines
description: Obtain Shariah Supervisory Board approval for new Islamic finance product structure and documentation

steps.title: Prepare Product Proposal for SSB Review
steps.description: Compile comprehensive product documentation including structure, contracts, fatwa basis, and Shariah compliance analysis

requiredEvidence.description: Detailed description of product mechanics, cash flows, and Islamic finance contract types used
All customer-facing and operational contracts in Arabic and English
Supporting fatwas from recognized scholars or Shariah boards for similar structures
Internal analysis of how product meets AAOIFI/IFSB requirements

policyConstraints.constraint: All new products must be reviewed by SSB before commercial launch

steps.title: Submit Proposal to SSB Secretariat
steps.description: Formally submit product proposal to SSB secretariat with all supporting documentation

requiredEvidence.description: Formal submission letter to SSB chairman requesting review
Acknowledgment from SSB secretariat with assigned review number

policyConstraints.constraint: Minimum 10 business days required for SSB review

steps.title: SSB Review and Deliberation
steps.description: SSB members review product structure, contracts, and Shariah compliance. May require clarifications or modifications

requiredEvidence.description: Record of SSB discussion, questions raised, and deliberation points
Any requests from SSB for additional information or modifications

policyConstraints.constraint: SSB must be independent - minimum 3 members with no conflicts of interest

steps.title: Obtain SSB Resolution (Formal Approval)
steps.description: Receive formal SSB resolution approving product structure and contracts. This is a HARD GATE - product cannot proceed without SSB approval

requiredEvidence.description: Formal written resolution signed by SSB members approving the product
Any conditions, restrictions, or monitoring requirements imposed by SSB
Final version of contracts approved by SSB (marked as 'Shariah-approved')

policyConstraints.constraint: SSB resolution is legally binding - product cannot launch without approval
SSB approval must be obtained before any customer transactions
